{{ Infobox Software | name = Apache OpenJPA | logo = | screenshot = | caption = | developer = [[Apache Software Foundation]] | status = Active | latest release version = 2.2.0 | latest release date = {{release date|2012|02|21}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | size = 33 MB (archived) | platform = [[Java platform|Java]] | programming language = [[Java (programming language)|Java]] | genre = [[Object-relational mapping]] | license = [[Apache License]] 2.0 | website = {{url|http://openjpa.apache.org}} }} '''OpenJPA''' is an [[open source software|open source]] implementation of the [[Java Persistence API]] specification. It is an [[object-relational mapping]] (ORM) solution for the [[Java (programming language)|Java]] language, which simplifies storing objects in databases. It is [[open source software|open source]] software distributed under the [[Apache License|Apache 2.0 Licence]].
== History == '''Kodo''', a [[Java Data Objects]] implementation, was originally developed by SolarMetric, Inc in 2001. [[BEA Systems]] acquired SolarMetric in 2005, where Kodo was expanded to be an implementation of both the [[Java Data Objects|JDO]] (JSR 12)<ref>Sun JCP [http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=12 JSR-12] Java Data Objects JDO Specification</ref> and [[Java Persistence API|JPA]] (JSR 220)<ref>Sun JCP [http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=220 JSR-220] Enterprise JavaBeansTM 3.0</ref> specifications. In 2006, BEA donated a large part of the Kodo source code to the [[Apache Software Foundation]] under the name '''OpenJPA'''. The donated source code will be the core persistence engine of [[Weblogic|BEA Weblogic Server]], [[IBM WebSphere]], and the [[Apache Geronimo|Geronimo]] Application Server.<ref>Both [[Weblogic|BEA Weblogic Server]] and [[IBM WebSphere]] adopted OpenJPA for java persistence framework.[http://www.infoq.com/news/2007/06/openjpa]</ref> In May 2007, OpenJPA graduated from the incubator to a top-level project and also passed Sun's [[Technology Compatibility Kit]] compliant with the Java Persistence API.<ref>[http://incubator.apache.org/projects/openjpa.html OpenJPA Project Incubation Status]</ref>
